listitem.para: scalars or matrices of reals or integer type (type = 1 or type = 8)
optional scalar string to set the underflow / overflow behavior: "drop" or "wrap". By default, mode = "wrap"

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Given x and y two integers, this function returns the number z whose binary form is that of x shifted by y bits.
If y<0, then the shifting is done to the right: z=x/2^abs(y). Otherwise (y>0), the shifting is done to the left: z=x*2^y. Lastly, if y=0, then z=x.
If x and y have the same size, then so does z. Otherwise, x or y must be a scalar and z has the size of the one that is not a scalar.

If x and y have integer types and generate an underflow/overflow, then if mode = "wrap", bitshift proceeds circularly; otherwise (mode = "drop"), bitshift caps the result to the maximum (resp minimum) value of the concerned integer type (thus preserving the sign of the input).
Rounding: the result for the odd elements of x is always truncated. For instance, shifting 31 with -1 yields 15, because 31/2 = 15.5 and shifting -31 with -1 yields -15.
